item.title: Arthur Hayes: Expects USD Stablecoin Supply to Reach $10 Trillion by 2028, Triggering DeFi Bull Run
item.description: August 28th. Arthur Hayes, the co-founder of BitMEX, recently released an article stating that by 2028, the total supply of USD-pegged stablecoins in circulation is projected to reach at least $10 trillion. This figure is significant considering the enormous and exponentially increasing deficit that the United States has to bear. The more Bezos finances the government with Treasury bills, the quicker the debt accumulates as he needs to roll over the debt annually.Consequently, this represents a once-in-a-century transformation of the global monetary architecture. "Perhaps, we will never encounter such an event again in our investment careers. You will never witness such a bull market in the foundational pillars of DeFi as these foundational pillars are reaping great benefits from the surge of USD-pegged stablecoins."

item.title: Solana's "150ms Block Finality Confirmation Achieved Major Consensus Upgrade" proposal has entered the voting stage.
item.description: August 28th. Based on the relevant governance page, the Solana "Achieve 150ms Block Finality Confirmation Major Consensus Upgrade" proposal (SIMD-326) has entered the voting stage.The voting rule stipulates that the approval vote ratio needs to reach 2/3 of the total votes (approval + rejection) in order to pass. Currently, the voting participation rate is approximately 9.87%, with approximately 9.758% being approval votes.

item.title: Yesterday, the United States Ethereum Spot ETF saw a net inflow of $307 million, while the Bitcoin Spot ETF saw a net inflow of $81.4 million.
item.description: On August 28th, as monitored by Farside Investors, the net inflow of the US Ethereum spot ETF was $307 million yesterday, indicating that it has witnessed net inflows for five consecutive days. Specifically, the BlackRock ETHA received a net inflow of $2.626 billion.Regarding the US Bitcoin spot ETF, it had a net inflow of $81.4 million yesterday, with IBIT seeing a net inflow of $50.9 million.

item.title: Statistics: Over the past 30 hours, a total of 78,891 ETH has been received by 4 new addresses, possibly for Bitmine
item.description: August 28th. In the past 30 hours, 4 new wallets (which may be related to Bitmine) have transferred 78,891 ETH to FalconX.

item.title: Whale qianbaidu.eth has deposited $5.72 million into Hyperliquid and has purchased $3.94 million worth of HYPE.
item.description: On August 28th, as per the monitoring of Onchain Lens, the whale "qianbaidu.eth" transferred $5.72 million into Hyperliquid and purchased 81,572.11 HYPE with $3.94 million. It still holds $1.787 million USDC and has placed a limit price buy order for HYPE at $48.2.

item.title: SOON Foundation Announces First Airdrop Guidelines for the simpfor.fun Mirror Trading Platform on Hyperliquid
item.description: August 28th: The SOON Foundation declared the initial batch of airdrop regulations for the Hyperliquid mirror trading platform simpfor.fun, anticipating the distribution of 1,500,000 SOON tokens.The airdrop will be centered around users' mirror trading volume on simpfor.fun. There is a base pool of 1,000,000 SOON and an additional pool of 500,000 SOON. The additional pool will offer a 30% to 70% bonus depending on the quantity of Coming SOON NFTs held. Currently, Simpfor.fun has a user base exceeding 250 million.

item.title: VanEck CEO: Ethereum is the "Wall Street Token," Stablecoin Growth Drives Traditional Financial Institutions' Demand for Ethereum
item.description: On August 28th, Jan F. van Eck, the CEO and president of VanEck, stated in an interview with FOX News that Ethereum is what I refer to as a "Wall Street Token." With the emergence of stablecoins, every bank - in fact, every financial services firm - must find a way to accept stablecoins. If I want to send you a stablecoin, your bank has to figure it out; otherwise, you will go to another institution that can handle it. "The people on Wall Street will eventually turn around and ask: What exactly is this thing? On which chain should I develop? The answer is Ethereum."Jan F. van Eck also stated that Ethereum was indeed despised by many earlier this year at its low point for various reasons. VanEck actually has a list of "actively managed ETFs."

item.title: Data: Over 60,000 Transaction Addresses in YZY Token Trading Experienced Losses, Accounting for Over 83% of the Total Address Count
item.description: August 28th. According to Bubblemaps' monitoring, since its issuance, the YZY token has seen the participation of more than 70,000 addresses in transactions. Among them:51,862 people lost an amount ranging from $1 to $1,000; 5,269 people lost between $1,000 and $10,000; 1,025 people lost from $10,000 to $100,000; 108 people lost from $100,000 to $1,000,000; and 3 people lost more than $1,000,000.It is worth noting that another 11 wallets have achieved profits exceeding $1,000,000.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Holds $7.21 Billion Ethereum ETF, Largest Institutional Holder
item.description: On August 28th, based on a 13F filing, Goldman Sachs held an Ethereum ETF worth $7.21 billion, emerging as the largest institutional holder. Next in line were Jane Street (with a holding of $1.9 billion) and Millennium (with a holding of $1.86 billion). (Cointelegraph)

item.title: Former US Treasury Secretary Yellen: Firing Cook is illegal and dangerous, US credibility is at risk
item.description: August 28th: In reaction to the controversy that was triggered by Trump's dismissal of Federal Reserve Board Governor Powell, former U.S. Treasury Secretary Yellen stated: Trump claims to have "fired" Powell with "valid reasons." This action is not only illegal but also extremely perilous.This is a blatant attempt to politicize the Federal Reserve. It is a threat to its leadership and an attempt to make monetary policy bow to the will of the president. Such an action could lead to the end of the Fed's independence—and what will follow is the collapse of the credibility of U.S. monetary policy at home and abroad.Yellen calls on Congress to safeguard the Fed's independence. The courts must reject this illegal abuse of power. The financial industry should also voice its opposition to this direct attack on the credibility of the dollar. (FXStreet)
